stimulusHtml: In his architectural designs such as the design of his home, Monticello, Thomas Jefferson chose a style that was inspired by ancient Roman architecture, because he
choicesHtml: wanted to show that culture in America was just as well rooted as culture in European countries
wanted to emulate the architectural style that was predominant in Britain at the time
believed that this style best expressed the values of the new American Republic
believed that Roman architecture was most suitable for the American geography and climate
